title: Would globalization be possible without technology? - Quora

response.answer_text: My first impulse was to say yes, thinking of centuries past, when trading across the world was robust, carried on only in sailing ships— and before that, over land in caravans. But on second thought, all those ships— and to a lesser extent, the caravan wagons— were a form of technology— that is, machinery that was the product of human innovation, and not merely the replication of what is found in nature. So no, globalization is probably not possible without technology. These days, that consists not only of carrying vessels, but also the complex computerization that handles logistics— scheduling, routing, delivery, and all the ancillary things that go with (maintenance/reparis, &c).

No. What makes globalization possible in today’s understanding of it is communication and logistics technology. The idea that I can, in real time, communicate, coordinate, and work with, someone on the other side of the globe radically changes the paradigm.
